messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, does not have a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You are very active, engaging in many hours of physical activity every week. You are someone who I neutral with my thinking style. I am very unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings rarely. I neutral that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts rarely. I neutral that my well-being is good. I disagree that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I strongly agree that I am emotionally stable and calm. I strongly agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I understand most of it. There are some terms that I don't understand which is why I ask them to go into more detail on what they are exactly saying.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
They are informative. If I don't understand something they go into more detail about what it is, etc. They give me all the information I need to understand what they are saying.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
What makes me most anxious is visiting the doctors office in general. Even if I don't go for a bad reason, and just a check up, I still get a bit anxious.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I ended up getting a sexually trasmitted diesease from an ex boyfriend that cheated on me. I was anxious to get the results back, and was put on medication to try and get right of it. I kept getting sick because of the medicine so they had to switch it at least once or twice just to make it go away

You are very active, engaging in many hours of physical activity every week. Living in the best possible health is very important to you. You are someone who I neutral with my thinking style. I am very unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings rarely. I neutral that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts never. I agree that my well-being is good. I agree that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I unknown that I am emotionally stable and calm. I strongly agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I usually feel comfortable with how I process basic health information.  I do as questions and what I don't understand I will research online.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My PCP I easy to talk to and seems non judgmental when giving me advice.  Plus she explains  things to me in plain, clear English not a bunch of medical jargon, that's why I trust her.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am generally concerned about my weight and how it may or may not be affecting my health.  I feel guilty about not exercising as often as I should.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I was pregnant with my daughter I tested positive for gestational diabetes.  I was not able to manage my glucose levels with just diet alone.  About half way throught I was prescribed medication.

I strongly disagree that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I agree that I am emotionally stable and calm. I agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel fairly confident in my understanding of basic health information. At times certain health lingo may need to be put into layman's terms by the doctor or nurse when asked but most of the time I understand what I am told or reading.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

For the most part I trust my doctor to monitor my health and if a problem presents help me find a reasonable solution. But I also people in human mistake and that sometimes you have to be your own health advocate.  Doctors don't always have the right answers and sometimes you have to be persistent if you feel something is not right.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I have generalized anxiety disorder so doctors appts for me while necessary tend to bring stress and anxiety. I become anxious about what my weight will be, what my blood pressure will be (most likely high due to the anxiety) etc. I just tend to be a very anxious person even when there is nothing to really worry about.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was having a certain problem that often can be mistaken for another very common health problem.  After many doctors visits, lab tests all coming back negative. There was still no resolution to my problem. With my own research and persistence I was able to present the Doctor with a possible diagnosis and once we both agree and I was given treatment my symptoms were almost gone or at least quite managable.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
Sometimes I have to Google medical terms that I did not fully understand. Most of the time my physician will fully explain anything I didn't comprehend. I know there is help if needed.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
In trust that my physician will tell me every truth I need to know. Referrals are always good. There hasn't been a reason yet to not fully trust in my physician.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Never really anxious. I'm usually pretty good when it comes to visiting my physician. I do tend to get worried  when I get an irregular result of some sort.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I went to donate plasma. Got told that I had arrhythmia. Didn't know much , so I googled it . Got my answers.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel that I have good capacity to process basic health information. I have worked around the medical field for a good part of my career, and I have an aptitude for it based on my college courses and how I think about these things. I feel that doctors are sometimes not great in gauging how much understanding patients have, but that does not bother me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think that the doctor is good at her job, but she is young and seems a little inexperienced. I am not sure if that's a good or bad thing though, as generatiol differences can cloud judgement and can cause physicians to not keep up with the times or to not realize the correct standards of care.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I think it's just the fear of the unknown. If I'm not going for any particular reason, you never know what they could find that could be potentially bad. It's just a little scary.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

An uncle of mine had issues with his shoulder. He asked me for advice, as I have some orthopedic knowledge. He had a shoulder replacement done but had some pain afterwards. I spoke with him and told him a few tests to have his orthopedist administer, and they found the underlying issue for most of his pain.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I completely understand basic Heath information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions for myself.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I'm not sure whether to fully trust  my primary care physician or not. It's hard to tell. However, I do give the physician the benefit of the doubt
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I'm not sure what they may find. Plus, I dread getting the news that I will need a blood test, which I hate.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I haven't really had an experience in my life that demonstrated my knowledge of health or medical issues.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
i think i am about average, i have had some but limited experience
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
my doctor misdiagnosed my low sodium
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
finding out something bad
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I had a two day stay at the hospital. I was treated for low sodium,because of a drug interaction. I had to answer a lot of questions and i learned a lot.

I strongly agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I ask questions while I am there with the doctor if something I need to understand better, or why we are changing medications.  Also once I have their diagnoses, I go on line to learn more about what it means, and also how it is treated, and what I can do or others have done to deal with the diagnoses.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I go to my GP with a concern about something, and even if she doesn't think that is what is happening, she will still follow through in checking herself, or else she will give me a referral to a physician that can give me peace.  Every specialist I have from her referrals has been just as interested, and just as careful to handle my concerns as my primary.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Follow up times make me anxious the most, as I am concerned that I haven't followed through they way the specialist has asked.  Concerned I didn't loose enough weight to meet their ideals between visits, even though most times my GP doesn't push too hard about it, and often I have lost, especially this year.  If the doctor's office calls me in my mind naturally goes to the bad news side of thinking.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My mother was diagnosed with an Arnold Chari Malformation 1, and after having several doctors work with this, and she under went the brain surgery, and the original doctor visited her in rehab, he sat down in the room, and asked about the journey.  Even the nurses were shocked, as this was out of character for this doctor, and yet he stopped everything with an interest to learn more, and because I know the medical terms respected me enough to really listen to the story instead of only half listening to things.

I agree that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I agree that I am emotionally stable and calm. I strongly agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel mostly confident in my ability to understand basic health information and all the decisions that go with it. My hesitancy so say I am 100% confident stems strictly from medical confusion I get from time to time. In the medical profession now there are so many differing opinions that anything more than one source (doctor) is involved, explations become a little jumbled in my mind because of their differing views. I think this sometimes inhibits my ability to make faster and firm decisions about my health.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My primary care doctor is mostly considerate and kind but often gives me the impression that he is overworked. He has had the tendency to forget certain things about me to the point where I have needed to remind him of things in visits (ie: medication allergy). He has never directly put me in danger with any of his decisions but I would trust him more if he was less rushed and willing to spend more time getting familiar with me and my health.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

My main worries are that my lab work would have shown something or that the doctor is dissatisfied with something in my health. My family has many health conditions that I am predisposed to that I also fear about showing eventually in my life.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Suffering from diverticulosis, I was in a conversation with another person who also had the pockets in their colon. I knew of some foods specifically popcorn, foods with skins and seeds that were known to aggravate the condition. I was able to tell them that those foods should be avoided which they did not know beforehand.

I strongly agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have been with the same doctor for about 15 years. I am very comfortable asking him questions about any issues I have. I do not feel like he rushes to get me out of the office. He takes his time and answers my questions. He is thorough in all my health care needs.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my primary care physician very much. He is thorough in my yearly check-ups. I have been seeing the same doctor for 17 years. He is very knowledgeable about my medical history so I am confident in asking questions if I have any.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I think the routine yearly visits do not make me anxious or stressed out. I think if I have to go for something other than a routine visit there is some stress. The stress or anxiety comes from not knowing if there is an issue or what the issue may be. With the diseases in today's society, such as cancer, when you have an unknown health issue there is usually anxiety that comes with it.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had an ultrasound on my uterus. The results came back showing a mass. I had another ultrasound done. I went to the same doctor and then I went for a second opinion. The first doctor told me to wait for six months and we would do another ultrasound to compare. The second doctor talked to me about the image and the mass and suggested surgery. I went to the second doctor.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel fairly confident that when I see medical professiols, I am getting the information I need specific to my situation. If there are areas I am unclear on, I try to ask questions to help myself understand. Thankfully I have the ability to contact them after the fact if there is something I didn't have fully explained while at an appointment.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Typically when I see a doctor, they are a medical resident. I actually feel more confident in this situation because I know that if there is any doubt, they will seek more information through their attending. I would say I usually trust the doctors I see, but I do like to keep myself informed by other means as well, just in case.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The thing that makes me most anxious is wondering if there will be something majorly wrong. I also worry that there won't be anything that can be done for symptoms that may be present.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I studied athletic training in college, and I've found that useful in emergent situations throughout life. If someone falls and cuts themselves or breaks something, I am confident enough to do what needs to be done immediately and then decide if they need to seek further medical attention. I recently helped an older gentleman who had tripped, fallen, and split his head. I knew to limit mobility until help arrived, and I knew to watch for signs of concussion (i.e. vomiting, blackout). I was able to help limit the loss of blood while we waited for the ambulance and kept him comfortable.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I am a smart and sharp engineer well schooled in most of the world's more difficult fields. I have little difficulty with reading for comprehension or with hiding or avoiding unpleasant situations.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
She is thorough, thoughtful and knowledgeable. My health is good. I have no data that argues for mis-trusting her
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Nothing worries me about going to the doctor. I live for my kids and I'm healthy. When God calls I'm ready to go.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My father had 2 major strokes. I managed his health for 3 years. I also have a significant person in my life with type 1 diabetes whom I assist manage the illness

I strongly agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I believe I have the capacity to understand some of the basics about health care.  The doctors and nurses do not take enough time, though to fully answer questions.  I feel like I'm on an assembly line when I go to the docs\ter.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I never completely trust anyone.  I think that all doctors are purely in it for the money first and patient well being a distant second.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

My biggest fear is that of being told that I have an incurable disease or only have a few months to live.  I think my fear is that my mother died when I was young and my father was very sick as I was growing up.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
We were hiking in the backwoods and my friend slipped and cut her hand.  She needed stitches and we were to far out to get help in  time.  I used my sewing kit to sew up her wound.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are very active, engaging in many hours of physical activity every week. You are someone who I strongly agree with my thinking style. I am extremely likely to engage in risk activities. To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I can see and read perfectly fine. I don't like it when the Dr. doesn't give you time to respond to any concern that have arisen while he is talking to you. I almost always feel rushed. And uncertain what was even said. I have had so many come in and start going on about what needs to happen or what is going on right away. They don't give you time to process anything. You might have a question early on and the not hear anything said after that. Or else completely forget the question you had trying to comprehend what is being said.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

They get in to mush of a hurry, it feels rushed. They will come in and start discussing what needs to be done and while I'm there I feel like I don't even talk the same language sometimes. I almost always look everything I can remember on line. It helps me figure out what is really going on.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I have a hard time comprehending people talking at me. I can't focus no matter how hard I try. I usually try remember key words and look up stuff later. They just get so rushed I don't want to be rude and keep interrupting. So I feel useless sometimes. And passed off that after 35 years of the pain no has an explanation.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have had unknown leg pain most of my life. I injured my back quite a few years ago, and I  have worked in a hospital a few years ago. I have take medical terminology classes. Biology classes. As well as as a few other classes to be a Naturopathic Practitioner.  I have yet to take the Anatomy classes.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
Completely comfortable with understanding health information and making an informed decision based on it.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
In general my physician does a thorough job. Never seem to be in a rush or anything.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Don't have any complications or disorder. Still anxious about needles since I was little.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When I was a young child my little brother had chicken pox. My parent didn't speak English that well so I filled the medical form for them.

I was prescribed a medication that could interact with another medication I was taking. I took that medication for months, seeing the same doctors and using the same pharmacy. It wasn't until my regular doctor (pain magement) was on vacation, an older doctor recognized the risk and took me off of it. This greatly reduced my amount of trust in both doctors and pharmacists. My PCP was also aware of the medications but, did not recognize the interaction.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I've met many rude doctors in my short life. It seems like there are may people that become doctors for the wrong reasons. In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I generally trust doctors because it is in their interest to make people feel better, and they have the training to do that. Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I worry about all the things that could be wrong with me that I didn't notice, but the doctor might find out. These might be expensive to fix, or embarassing, or something that I was foolish not to notice on my own. I might not be in as good of health as I had thought.

I am currently pregnt, so I have been doing a lot of research online about possible things that could affect my pregncy and make it more complicated. One thing is high blood pressure and how it is linked to pre-eclampsia. I read about how if you have high blood pressure then they will likely do a urine test to see if there is protein in it, which is a sign of pre-eclampsia. I can have high blood pressure sometimes, so it was no surprise to me when the midwife ordered a urine test to see if there was protein present.
